title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic suggests he could leave MLS THIS WEEKEND
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic has hinted he could return to the Premier League.

The LA Galaxy striker's contract expires in December but his last match could be on Sunday as his side face a play-off against Minnesota.

Ibrahimovic was released by Manchester United in 2017 but admits Sunday's game may be his last.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic has hinted he could return to the Premier League when his contract expires

'Could be,' said Ibrahimovic in quotes reported by Goal.

'There are no other thoughts, I respect my contract. If I leave you will have less to write about.

'If I stay you will still have something to write about. Let's see what happens. But let's focus on the play-off. I think [my future] is not the right thing to discuss.

'I've had a good time, good experience. I've learned a lot on how it works here, still a work in progress.

'I've enjoyed it and that's the most important. I came back from my injury and came like a little kid that just wanted to enjoy football. MLS gave me the opportunity and I took it.'

Ibrahimovic has recently joked that United could need him after the Red Devils have only two senior strikers in Marcus Rashford and Anthony Martial.
description: Zlatan Ibrahimovic has hinted he could return to the Premier League. The LA Galaxy striker's contract expires in December but his last match could be on Sunday.
